article.il: "Hey, man! It's a 'Right to Riot' riot!"

article.ti: "You'll have to do something, boss—that Tory MP's been in there since last week"
article.il: "You'll have to do something, boss—that Tory MP's been in there since last week"

article.ti: "I've arrived at the age when my mother used to say,'When you get to my age You'll understand these things'"

article.ti: All Dressed up and Rarin' to Go

article.il: "Ever have one of those days when you wish you were unemployed?"
"This could solve the housing problem, They're a damn sight more comfortable than tower blocks"
"Sam! You've forgotten your Donor Card!" "as if we haven't got enough trouble—We're going to have a CS gas sniffing problem next! "
"Typical! There's never a policeman around when you really want one!"
"Quick! Tell the station they've started looting! "
"Women!"

article.ti: "Could all be part of the softer image"
article.il: "Could all be part of the softer image"

article.ti: "You never sit down with a good book"
article.il: "You never sit down with a good book"

article.il: "A limited edition? I saw it as a well-thumbed, dog-eared paperback"

article.ti: "It's 10 p. m. Have you read Thackeray or Trollope yet?"
article.il: "It's 10 p. m. Have you read Thackeray or Trollope yet?"

article.ti: "No matter how much he begs, don't lend him any money"
article.il: "No matter how much he begs, don't lend him any money"

article.ti: "First year they've bothered to ask what it does to the gallon"
article.il: "First year they've bothered to ask what it does to the gallon"

article.ti: "There was also the time the Network pulled the plug on the crucial last over of the Gillette Cup final at Lord's . . . …
article.il: "There was also the time the Network pulled the plug on the crucial last over of the Gillette Cup final at Lord's . . . "
"Happy, darling?"
"When her diaries won the Booker Prize, that was the last straw!"
"Testing! Testing!"
"You spend all your time kissing babies! why not this one?"

article.ti: "He's in constant contact with everyone except me"
article.il: "He's in constant contact with everyone except me"

article.ti: "How about dot, dot, dot? that usually gets their knickers in a twist"
article.il: "How about dot, dot, dot? that usually gets their knickers in a twist"

article.ta: Publishing is traditionally a Gentleman's Profession but in London secretaries—yes, ordinary little female secretaries—have clawed and are still clawing their way to the top

article.ti: To Hav and to Hav Not
article.ta: Jan Morris, whose mysterious first novel, Last Letters from Hav, is on the Booker short list, solves some of the mystery

Sally Vincent discovers that Kingsley Amis's controversial novel, attacked here as sexist and only just come out in New York after furious opposition, is not the work of a male chauvinist pig but . . . A great novel

article.ta: Jeremy Lewis, himself a publisher, takes a look at all the recent take-overs in London publishing

article.ti: "Fascinating manuscript—proves that Agatha Christie's butler wrote all her books"
article.il: "Fascinating manuscript—proves that Agatha Christie's butler wrote all her books"
"I know about Evelyn Waugh's ear-trumpet and T. S. Eliot's truss, but Robert Robinson's brush and comb set?"

article.ti: "But you're not Freddie Forsyth, and I'm not one of the publishers who turned him down"
article.il: "But You're not Freddie Forsyth, and I'm not one of the publishers who turned him down"
"Returning from the celebration", George Grosz (1924)

article.ti: "Would you just accept an autograph? He doesn't have time to add 'Deputy Chairman, Conservative Party'"
article.il: "Would you just accept an autograph? He doesn't have time to add 'Deputy Chairman, Conservative Party'"
"He says it's his muse, but I think it's Edith Husselmeyer with a fake nose and a fright wig"
"It's that half-with cartoonist"
"Well, one of us better sober up"
"Strictly speaking, it's not my muse. It's my ex-wife's dead mother"

article.ta: An updated extract from Headlong Hall, to mark the bicentenary of the birth of satirist Thomas Love Peacock

article.ti: "My God, if the enemy ever find out that Radetsky can't march . . ."

article.ti: "You wouldn't happen to have a dictionary, would you? They say there's an axolotl on the loose"

1906 caption—More Swedish Instruction. Instructress (To Exhausted Class, who Have Been Hopping round Room for Some Time). "Come! Come! that Won't Do at All. You Must Look Cheerful. Keep Smiling—Smiling All the Time!"
1932 caption—Hiker. "Good-Morning, Boniface. " Innkeeper. "Bunnyface Yerself!"
